Sure. I guess so.

Double Punch's missiles hit Stegotron in the back. "Ha!" Stegotron thought, "They keep shooting missiles at my back where my back plate armor is. He kept firing at Injector.
Ultracon gets hit by Double Punch's missile and it nocks him to his knees. He gets back up and fires his fusion cannon at where he thinks Double Punch is.
Triceradon dodges Bumblebee's blasts and fires his gernade launcher back at  him.
nbwrpg@egroups.com wrote:
>
> (Trike, if that's what you want to be called, Beeline was caught in a blast 
> and slammed into a tree branch. �He is operable. �Do you still want to shoot 
> him. �If you reply yes in your next post, I'll take the damage in my next 
> post)
> 
> 
> Double Punch/Injector/Counter Punch/Double Punch/Bumblebee/Shockwave:
> 
> 
> 
> Double Punch smiled. �They hadn't noticed his stealth mode had been damaged 
> and was now off until he let repairs fix it. �Speaking of repairs, who the 
> slag was that purple freak that was shooting missiles?! �Raising both pinches 
> as he Stegotron still standing he fired two missiles from each pincher. �Two 
> at the middle of Stegotron's back, two at the back of Ultracon's left knee. �
> "I'll have to use my stinger if this doesn't bring them to their knees."
> 
> ---
> 
> Injector jumped to the left, firing stinger missiles at Stegotron as he 
> passed by the near gone tree he had been using for cover, landing behind a 
> small boulder that wouldn't last long under fire.
> 
> --- 
> 
> Counter Punch ducked, a shot hitting his left shoulder. �Raising his photon 
> rifle with his right arm, he fired off several shots at Ultracon's chest.
> 
> ---
> 
> Bumblebee cursed. �Sliding through the air to the left, only one of Dark 
> Mouse's shots grazed his right side. �He didn't seen Triceradon's grenade. �
> Looking to it, it exploded, launching him through the air. �Regaining 
> balance, his body lightly charred and one of his optics offline and hanging 
> out of its "socket", he raised both launcher, firing three stinger missiles 
> from each at Dark Mouse, and two optic blasts from his good optic at 
> Triceradon.
> 
> ---
> 
> Assessing the battle, Shockwave picked out the weakest of them all. �An 
> already damaged being. �If he was going to kill someone and help his own 
> cause, logic would dictate it be a puny Maximal. �Taking out a missile 
> launcher, he used one hand to aim it, raising his laser weapon that was 
> imbedded in his hand to give it extra support as he held it, he pulled the 
> trigger, a rocket surging out at Dark Mouse.
> 
>
